item.title: 联合利华在英国和爱尔兰召回 Magnum 杏仁冰淇淋棒
item.description: 联合利华公司（Unilever Plc）发布公告称，由于产品中可能含有塑料和金属，为谨慎起见，将在英国和爱尔兰召回少量玛格南杏仁雪糕棒。【原文：Unilever Plc is recalling a limited number of its Magnum almond ice-cream sticks in the UK and Ireland as a precaution due to the possible presence of plastic and metal, according to a company notice.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织新政临近，厄瓜多尔债券引领新兴市场涨势
item.description: 由于有迹象表明厄瓜多尔即将与国际货币基金组织达成新的融资协议，厄瓜多尔的美元债券跳涨，在发展中国家中涨幅居前。【原文：Ecuador’s dollar bonds jumped, leading gains among developing nations on signs a new financing deal with the International Monetary Fund is imminent.】

item.title: 萨尔瓦多在全球债务出售后回购 4.87 亿美元债券
item.description: 萨尔瓦多近四年来首次进入全球资本市场，回购了 4.87 亿美元的硬通货债券。【原文：El Salvador bought back $487 million of its hard-currency bonds after tapping the global capital market for the first time in almost four years.】

item.title: 前巴利亚斯尼伦敦办事处主管欧文关闭其对冲基金
item.description: 大约四年前，斯蒂芬-欧文（Stephen Irvine）离开巴利亚斯尼资产管理公司（Balyasny Asset Management），创办了自己的对冲基金，并将资金返还给投资者。【原文：Stephen Irvine, who left Balyasny Asset Management to start his own hedge fund about four years ago, is returning capital to investors.】

item.title: 养老金和捐赠基金模仿对冲基金的 "Pod Shop "策略
item.description: 养老金和捐赠基金正在借鉴巨型多管理人对冲基金的做法，自己也在尝试。【原文：Pensions and endowments are borrowing from the playbook of giant multimanager hedge funds — and giving it a go themselves.】

item.title: 虫害困扰阿根廷农作物，米莱恢复计划遭遇挫折
item.description: 在近乎完美的天气条件结束了多年的干旱之后，阿根廷玉米种植者对本季的收成寄予厚望。创纪录的收成也预示着哈维尔-米莱伊总统扭转国家陷入困境的经济的计划将获得成功。【原文：Argentina corn farmers had high hopes for this season’s harvest after near-perfect weather conditions ended years of drought. A record crop would also bode well for President Javier Milei’s plan to turn around the nation’s embattled economy.】

item.title: 津巴布韦希望今年启动由工作人员监督的国际货币基金组织（IMF）项目
item.description: 津巴布韦自 1999 年以来就因拖欠债务而被逐出资本市场，它希望在今年晚些时候加深与国际货币基金组织的联系，因为它正努力清偿数十亿美元的欠款。【原文：Zimbabwe, banished from capital markets since 1999 for defaulting on its debt, hopes to deepen ties with the International Monetary Fund later this year as it seeks to clear billions of dollars in arrears.】

item.title: 在这个不确定的时代，我们需要做的也许只是买些 T-Bill，然后冷静下来
item.description:
市场已经 "延伸和伪装"，因此或许可以说惯性是有道理的

。【原文：

Markets have ‘extended and pretended,’ so perhaps there is something to say for inertia

】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长西波罗内认为通胀趋势若持续将放宽政策
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员皮埃罗-西波隆（Piero Cipollone）表示，如果消费价格增长持续放缓，欧洲中央银行可能会放宽货币政策立场。【原文：The European Central Bank may be able to loosen its monetary-policy stance if the slowdown in consumer-price growth persists, according to Executive Board member Piero Cipollone.】

item.title: 英国央行官员警告抗击通胀的最后一程 "坎坷
item.description: 英国央行政策制定者梅根-格林（Megan Greene）表示，随着各国央行挤出全球通胀冲击的最终影响，包括英国在内的发达经济体将面临 "颠簸的旅程"，利率可能不得不保持在高于一些人预期的水平。【原文：Bank of England policy maker Megan Greene said developed economies including the UK face a “bumpy ride” as central banks squeeze out the final effects of the global inflation shock, and interest rates may have to stay higher than some expect.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织将肯尼亚 44.3 亿美元项目谈判延长至华盛顿
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）对肯尼亚 44.3 亿美元融资计划的审查将在工作人员访问东非国家后继续在华盛顿进行。【原文：An International Monetary Fund review of Kenya’s $4.43 billion funding program will continue in Washington following a staff mission to the East African nation.】

item.title: 意大利央行称第一季度经济略有增长
阿根廷顶级 CEO 在巴塔哥尼亚务虚会上盛赞米莱
item.description: 爱德华多-埃尔斯滕（Eduardo Elsztain）担心，在三位数的通胀率击垮消费支出的情况下，他的购物中心的销售额会受到影响。然而，在哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）就任总统四个月后，这位房地产大亨比以往任何时候都更看好阿根廷。【原文：Eduardo Elsztain is bracing for sales to suffer at his shopping malls amid triple-digit inflation that’s crushed consumer spending. Yet four months into Javier Milei’s presidency, the real estate mogul is more bullish on Argentina than ever.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称中美债务给全球公共财政带来风险
item.description: 国际货币基金组织的官员在一份报告中说，中国和美国这两个世界上最大的经济竞争对手将在未来五年内推动全球公共债务的大部分增长，美国的支出将使利率居高不下，从而给许多其他国家带来麻烦。【原文：The world’s two great economic rivals, China and the US, will drive much of the increase in global public debt over the next five years, with US spending creating trouble for many other countries by keeping interest rates high, officials at the International Monetary Fund said in a report.】

item.title: 斯坦查特称斯里兰卡有望在五月中旬达成债券持有人交易
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered）的策略师表示，斯里兰卡可能会在 5 月中旬之前与投资者达成协议，重组其 120 亿美元的全球违约债券。【原文：Sri Lanka may reach a deal with investors to restructure its $12 billion in defaulted global bonds by mid-May, according to strategists at Standard Chartered.】

item.title: 鲍威尔的美国利率警告意味着世界其他地区的头痛
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）正在让他在世界各地的同僚们的日子变得更加艰难，因为美国利率长期走高的前景减少了其他地方采取更宽松政策的空间。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is making life tougher for his peers around the world as the prospect of higher-for-longer US interest rates reduces room for easier policy elsewhere.】

item.title: 乌克兰 Astarta 公司计划在欧盟限制下向外销售更多食糖
item.description: 由于欧盟收紧了从乌克兰进口食糖的规定，乌克兰食糖生产商 Astarta Holding Plc 计划加强对欧盟以外地区的出口。【原文：Ukrainian sugar producer Astarta Holding Plc plans to step up exports outside of the European Union as the bloc tightens rules on imports from the country.】

item.title: 英国法院裁定伦敦对 ED&F Man 资本市场的突袭行动合法
item.description: 英国法官裁定，对 ED&F Man Capital Markets Ltd. 伦敦办事处的突袭是合法的，这次突袭是代表丹麦和德国当局进行的，是他们在 2022 年进行的大规模 Cum-Ex 交易调查的一部分。【原文：The raid into the London offices of ED&F Man Capital Markets Ltd., carried out on behalf of Danish and German authorities as part of their sprawling Cum-Ex trading probe in 2022, was lawful, UK judges ruled.】

item.title: 阿达尼再注资 10 亿美元增持 Ambuja 水泥公司股份
item.description: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）及其家族追加投资 834 亿卢比（10 亿美元），增持安布贾水泥有限公司（Ambuja Cements Ltd.）的股份，因为这家领先的水泥生产商将从印度的基础设施建设前景中获益。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and his family invested an additional 83.4 billion rupees ($1 billion) to increase their holding in Ambuja Cements Ltd. as the leading cement maker positions itself to benefit from the country’s infrastructure prospects.】

item.title: 欧洲央行森特诺称是时候改变货币政策了
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马里奥-森特诺（Mario Centeno）认为，欧洲中央银行应该很快开始降息。【原文：The European Central Bank should start lowering interest rates soon, according to Governing Council member Mario Centeno.】

item.title: 禁烟令和 "无烟 "吸管：关于烟草未来的争论
item.description: 随着全球吸烟率的下降，一些国家甚至试图禁止吸烟，烟草公司找到了其他赚钱的方法，满足人们对尼古丁的渴望，尼古丁是烟草中令人上瘾的兴奋剂。无烟 "尼古丁产品的销量正在蚕食香烟和其他可燃物的销量。然而，卫生官员在是否应该纵容这些产品的问题上存在分歧。虽然尼古丁产品的致命性低于香烟，但它们同样容易让使用者上瘾，而且还可能对人体有害。【原文：As rates of smoking decline worldwide, and some countries even try to ban it, tobacco companies have found other ways to make money by satisfying people’s hankering for nicotine, the addictive stimulant found in tobacco. Sales of “smoke-free” nicotine products are eating into those of cigarettes and other combustibles. Yet health officials are divided as to whether they should condone these products. While less deadly than cigarettes, they can hook users just as easily and may also have harmful】

item.title: 由 Citadel 投资的 Prime Brokerage 正在洽谈筹集新资金的事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在数字资产市场反弹的背景下，由 Citadel Securities 支持的一家初创黄金经纪公司成为寻求筹集新资金的最新公司。【原文：A startup prime brokerage backed by Citadel Securities is the latest firm looking to raise new funds amid a bounceback in the digital-asset market, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利通过四部分交易加入银行债券大军
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）在公布第一季度收入超出预期后的第二天就开始出售债券，与摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）和富国银行（Wells Fargo & Co.）等竞争对手一样，在公布盈利后进入美国投资级市场。【原文：Morgan Stanley is selling bonds a day after reporting first-quarter revenue that exceeded expectations, joining rivals JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Wells Fargo & Co. in tapping the US investment-grade market after posting earnings.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司凭借订单量成为巴西最佳股票
item.description: 巴西航空工业公司（Embraer SA）进军长期由波音公司（Boeing Co.【原文：Embraer SA’s push into a market long dominated by Boeing Co. and Airbus SE is bearing fruit in equity markets, as a flow of new orders from North America and Europe to Asia sends the stock soaring.】

item.title: 喜力尼日利亚分公司因外汇成本上涨关闭两家工厂
item.description: 喜力公司（Heineken NV）尼日利亚分公司暂时关闭了在这个西非国家的两家工厂，原因是货币贬值导致成本增加，削弱了消费者的购买力。【原文：Heineken NV’s Nigerian unit temporarily shut two factories in the West African nation, plagued by the depreciation of the currency that increased costs and impaired the purchasing power of consumers.】

item.title: 拜登面临委内瑞拉石油制裁的艰难抉择
item.description:
美国总统必须追究马杜罗的责任，同时在大选年控制国内天然气价格。【原文：

The US president must hold Maduro to account while keeping a lid on domestic gas prices in an election year.

】

item.title: 据说道富将探索收购法国兴业银行的托管部门
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在这家法国银行努力精简业务之际，道富公司正在探索收购法国兴业银行（Societe Generale SA）托管业务的可能性。【原文：State Street Corp. is exploring a potential acquisition of Societe Generale SA’s custody business, people with knowledge of the matter said, as the French lender pushes to streamline its operations.】

item.title: 美国合众银行在存款压力下下调贷款收入预期
item.description: 由于贷方面临为存款支付更多费用的压力，美国合众银行（U.S. Bancorp）下调了本年度利润主要驱动因素的展望。【原文：U.S. Bancorp reduced the outlook for a key driver of its profit for the year as lenders face pressure to pay more for deposits.】

item.title: 对冲基金抛售获胜能源股 买入飙升石油股
item.description: 随着能源股的交易接近历史高点，石油价格也在攀升，对冲基金认为他们已经找到了一个可以利用的交易：卖出股票，将利润用于购买更多原油。【原文：With energy stocks trading near all-time highs and oil climbing as well, hedge funds think they’ve found a trade to capitalize: Sell the shares and pour the profits into buying more crude.】

item.title: 银行家因放弃新工作而被收取数百万分手费
item.description: 银行家们正在将 "分手费 "这一长期以来在企业收购中固定使用的概念应用于一种截然不同的收购目标：彼此。【原文：Bankers are applying the idea of a “breakup fee,” a longtime fixture in corporate takeovers, to a very different kind of acquisition target: each other.】
